question: The Kvinna Till Kvinna foundation (Sweden) was award Right Livelihood Award in 2002 for
option1: its remarkable successes in healing the wounds of ethnic hatred and war, by helping women, often the prime victims, to be the major agents of reconciliation and peace-building
option2: outstanding courage and persistent efforts to expose and bring to account the tortures
option3: Their exemplary and indomitable courage and compassion, which have proved that, even after murderous civil war, young people from different ethnic groups can learn to live and build a future together in peace and harmony
answer: its remarkable successes in healing the wounds of ethnic hatred and war, by helping women, often the prime victims, to be the major agents of reconciliation and peace-building
